bibl.title: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, September 6, 1890

div1.p: Lazear writes about the beginning of his voyage home.

div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, September 6, 1890
div1.p:
As our steamer
stops at Boulogne, I thought
I would write a few lines to
you in the hope that it will
catch some fast steamer and
reach you before we arrive.
We started from Amsterdam
this morning and until noon
we were steaming along through
a canal connecting the Zuyder
Zee with the ocean. In that way
I got a good look at the
country of Hollands with its
dams, dikes and windmills.
After we got out into the channel
we struck a fog which lasted
for some time but it is now
perfectly clear. We had to go
very slowly in the fog, as there
are a great many boats in
the channel. The water is
very smooth.

I am very much pleased with
this vessel. The stateroom is
large and comfortable and airy,
and the table has been very
good. We have four meals
a day one being a supper at
nine o'clock. The more they have
the better I like it for I am
always hungry on shipboard.
I hope you will write me a
letter to me c/o Mrs. Denison so
I can get it on my arrival.
div1.closer:
Your affectionate Son --J. W. L. I notice by the passenger list that
Mr. Clement Fetedoux will be a
passenger on this boat getting on
at Boulogne
